title: How to Make an Imitation Painted Glass Pendant from Food Packaging

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/PS6_901.gif","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e6\/PS6_901.gif","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":588,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":971.1111111111111,"licensing":"

steps.description:
Check the label of the packaging to ensure that you are using type PS6, which is polystyrene material. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Ps1_983.JPG/460px-Ps1_983.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9f/Ps1_983.JPG/760px-Ps1_983.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}The packaging used for this project. In this case it is a clear lid off a container but you could also use a disposable plate, or other polystyrene product with the right label on it.

steps.headline: Draw your design or picture on a flat part of the Polystyrene.
steps.description:
{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps3_625.JPG/460px-Ps3_625.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps3_625.JPG/760px-Ps3_625.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Continue with the whole design but don't go out to the edges; this part is going to shrink. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Ps4_958.JPG/460px-Ps4_958.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Ps4_958.JPG/760px-Ps4_958.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Aim to alternate some of the colors on separate sides of the plastic. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Ps5_400.JPG/460px-Ps5_400.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Ps5_400.JPG/760px-Ps5_400.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Also do the outlining on the opposite side of the plastic. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Ps6_684.JPG/460px-Ps6_684.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Ps6_684.JPG/760px-Ps6_684.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}In doing so, you will get a lovely stereoscopic effect. And that can prevent the marker dye transfer.

steps.headline: Cut around the design.
steps.description: Cut with care so as to leave smooth edges. Leave an uncolored, plain edge space with no design (unlike the image here) to allow for shrinkage.

steps.headline: Create a hole in the part of the item that you'd like to be the "top" of the pendant.
steps.description: Use a simple hole punch to achieve this.

steps.headline: Use crumpled, recycled aluminum foil to line an oven tray.
steps.description:
Preheat an oven or toaster oven to 325°. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps9_395.JPG/459px-Ps9_395.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps9_395.JPG/759px-Ps9_395.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Place the plastic design onto the foil and put into the oven when the temperature is hot. Wear oven mitts for this step and the following step.

steps.headline: Watch it shrink.
steps.description: Careful! This will happen very quickly so do not leave it unattended. When it shrinks as wished, remove it with tongs or chopsticks. Place the hot plastic pendant onto a ceramic plate to cool.

steps.headline: Wait for it cool down.
steps.description:
Once cooled, use as a pendant, keyring, or anything else you think it'd look good as. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Ps12_645.JPG/460px-Ps12_645.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Ps12_645.JPG/760px-Ps12_645.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}The finished design.

tyn: Polystyrene plate or packaging (must be Polystyrene #PS6 type); note that it shrinks about 1/5th during heating

"}In doing so, you will get a lovely stereoscopic effect. And that can prevent the marker dye transfer. Cut around the design. Cut with care so as to leave smooth edges. Leave an uncolored, plain edge space with no design (unlike the image here) to allow for shrinkage. Create a hole in the part of the item that you'd like to be the "top" of the pendant. Use a simple hole punch to achieve this. Use crumpled, recycled aluminum foil to line an oven tray. Preheat an oven or toaster oven to 325°. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps9_395.JPG/459px-Ps9_395.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps9_395.JPG/759px-Ps9_395.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons

"}Place the plastic design onto the foil and put into the oven when the temperature is hot. Wear oven mitts for this step and the following step. Watch it shrink. Careful! This will happen very quickly so do not leave it unattended. When it shrinks as wished, remove it with tongs or chopsticks. Place the hot plastic pendant onto a ceramic plate to cool. Wait for it cool down. Once cooled, use as a pendant, keyring, or anything else you think it'd look good as. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Ps12_645.JPG/460px-Ps12_645.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Ps12_645.JPG/760px-Ps12_645.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

In this case it is a clear lid off a container but you could also use a disposable plate, or other polystyrene product with the right label on it.
Draw your design or picture on a flat part of the Polystyrene.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps3_625.JPG/460px-Ps3_625.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps3_625.JPG/760px-Ps3_625.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Continue with the whole design but don't go out to the edges; this part is going to shrink.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Ps4_958.JPG/460px-Ps4_958.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fd/Ps4_958.JPG/760px-Ps4_958.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Aim to alternate some of the colors on separate sides of the plastic.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Ps5_400.JPG/460px-Ps5_400.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Ps5_400.JPG/760px-Ps5_400.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Also do the outlining on the opposite side of the plastic.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Ps6_684.JPG/460px-Ps6_684.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Ps6_684.JPG/760px-Ps6_684.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}In doing so, you will get a lovely stereoscopic effect.
And that can prevent the marker dye transfer.
Cut around the design.
Cut with care so as to leave smooth edges.
Leave an uncolored, plain edge space with no design (unlike the image here) to allow for shrinkage.
Create a hole in the part of the item that you'd like to be the "top" of the pendant.
Use a simple hole punch to achieve this.
Use crumpled, recycled aluminum foil to line an oven tray.
Preheat an oven or toaster oven to 325°.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps9_395.JPG/459px-Ps9_395.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ea/Ps9_395.JPG/759px-Ps9_395.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

TOHGIN minako

Image by: Uploader
License: Creative Commons

"}Place the plastic design onto the foil and put into the oven when the temperature is hot.
Wear oven mitts for this step and the following step.
Watch it shrink.
Careful!
This will happen very quickly so do not leave it unattended.
When it shrinks as wished, remove it with tongs or chopsticks.
Place the hot plastic pendant onto a ceramic plate to cool.
Wait for it cool down.
Once cooled, use as a pendant, keyring, or anything else you think it'd look good as.

{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Ps12_645.JPG/460px-Ps12_645.JPG","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Ps12_645.JPG/760px-Ps12_645.JPG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"
